content: Is Brazil a part of the United Nations Security Council?

Yes, Brazil is a member of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). The UNSC is one of the six principal organs of the United Nations and is responsible for maintaining international peace and security. It consists of 15 members: five permanent members (China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States) and ten non-permanent members elected for two-year terms. Brazil has been elected as a non-permanent member several times, most recently in 2022 for the term 2022-2023.
